Hi All, 

I've been kicking around the idea of building a Laythe colony, and while I have a surface base, seaplane, and refueling rover currently en route, I was wondering if there was a mod to allow the construction of a remote space center for the construction and launching of new vehicles.

This thread mentioned the mod "Alien Space Programs," but I notice the thread is now 2 years old. Is this still the most current/appropriate mod for something like this? Can you specify the latitude/longitude of the constructed space center? Is there any cost/build time associated with this, or does it just pop into existence?

In case it matters, I'm currently running a legacy version of KSP (1.2.2 x64, Windows), with Interstellar-Extended Mod.

 

Thanks for your feedback. 

--miamijuggler

There are newer versions of Alien Space program but you don`t need the newest one because you use KSP 1.2.2.

https://github.com/GregroxMun/Alien-Space-Programs/releases/tag/v1.5.1

You could also try Extraplanetary Launchpads, which allows the construction of ships in-situ. However, it is quite big and complicated.

Edited December 6, 2018 by RealKerbal3x

Alien Space Program would require a new game though.

it sounds like Kerbal Konstructs might be more what you want.

Hey, @miamijuggler !
Maybe we´re in a very alike situation...

I´ve been using Hyperedit for building bases on Kerbin and role-playing´em into other planets/moons, where I "created" new KSCs.
You take your creations to the launchpads, runways or wherever you want, then click to transfer-and-land them, gently, in any "geo"graphic coordinates or even flags/vessels you have already set.
 

:::::::::

In my relatively newbie opinion, it´s a lot less "realistic" than Extraplanetary Launchpads, as you don´t need to actually gather the materials on alien places but, if you´re playing a career mode, you still have the costs to build AND, let´s say, launch it into Kerbin´s orbit, and just then to cheat it anywhere beyond. 

Edited December 8, 2018 by Cataclism
Good to know, everyone. Thank you for your input! I'll do some deeper delving into these options once I have a bit of time (not much of that for KSP these days, I'm afraid).
